content: At the end of the story of "The Joy Luck Club," Jing-mei promises "the aunties" that she will keep their memory and legacy alive by continuing to play mahjong and gather together with her own daughters. The promise is a way for Jing-mei to honor the aunties and their friendship, as well as to ensure that their traditions and cultural heritage are passed down to future generations. By making this promise, Jing-mei demonstrates her appreciation for the aunties and her commitment to preserving their memories and maintaining the bonds of family and community that they so strongly valued. In this way, Jing-mei's promise serves as a symbol of the importance of tradition, cultural heritage, and the strength of familial bonds in the lives of Chinese-American immigrants.
